org.aksw.iguana.rp.metrics

Class AbstractMetric

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.aksw.iguana.rp.metrics.AbstractMetric
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Metric
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    EachQueryMetric, NoQPHMetric, QPSMetric

    public abstract class AbstractMetric
extends java.lang.Object
implements Metric
    Abstract Metric class which implements the method sendData so the final Metric class can send their final data via this command to the storages
    Author:
    f.conrads

      protected StorageManager storageManager 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      AbstractMetric()
      This constructor will not set name, Short name and description Thus the final Metric class has to set them itself.
      AbstractMetric(java.lang.String name, java.lang.String shortName, java.lang.String description)
      Will create an Metric class with the name, short name and description

      protected void sendTriples(java.util.Properties results, java.util.Set<java.lang.String> isResource, java.util.Properties recv, Triple[] add)
      Will call the storageManager sendData method with the Lightweight Meta and the following created triples
      The triples add will be simply added
      The subject node will be calculated from the recv Object wiht the getSubjectFromExtraMeta(java.util.Properties) Method

      • sendTriples

        protected void sendTriples(java.util.Properties results)
        Will call the storageManager sendData method with the Lightweight Meta and the following created triples
        The subject node will be calculated by an empty Properties Object and the getSubjectFromExtraMeta(java.util.Properties)

        For each key:value pair: subject results.key results.value

        Parameters:
        results -

      • sendTriples

        protected void sendTriples(java.util.Properties results,
                           java.util.Properties recv)
        Will call the storageManager sendData method with the Lightweight Meta and the following created triples
        The subject node will be calculated by the recv Object and the getSubjectFromExtraMeta(java.util.Properties)

        For each key:value pair: subject results.key results.value

        The getExtraMeta() method will be called, with the recv Property and the subject node Thus the following triples will be added:
        For each key:value pair: subject recv.key recv.value
        Parameters:
        results -
        recv -

      • sendTriples

        protected void sendTriples(java.util.Properties results,
                           java.util.Set<java.lang.String> isResource,
                           java.util.Properties recv,
                           Triple[] add)
        Will call the storageManager sendData method with the Lightweight Meta and the following created triples
        The triples add will be simply added
        The subject node will be calculated from the recv Object wiht the getSubjectFromExtraMeta(java.util.Properties) Method

        For each key:value pair: subject results.key results.value
        Be aware that the Set isResource will set if the key/value will be handled as resources. If the key (value) is in the set it will be handled as a resource

        The getExtraMeta() method will be called, with the recv Property and the subject node Thus the following triples will be added:
        For each key:value pair: subject recv.key recv.value
        Parameters:
        results -
        isResource -
        recv -
        add -

      • sendTriples

        protected void sendTriples(java.lang.String subject,
                           java.util.Properties results,
                           java.util.Set<java.lang.String> isResource,
                           java.util.Properties recv)
        Will call the storageManager sendData method with the Lightweight Meta and the following created triples
        The subject node will be the subject for every following triple

        For each key:value pair: subject results.key results.value
        Be aware that the Set isResource will set if the key/value will be handled as resources. If the key (value) is in the set it will be handled as a resource

        The getExtraMeta() method will be called, with the recv Property and the subject node Thus the following triples will be added:
        For each key:value pair: subject recv.key recv.value
        Parameters:
        subject -
        results -
        isResource -
        recv -

      • sendTriples

        protected void sendTriples(java.lang.String subject,
                           java.util.Properties results,
                           java.util.Set<java.lang.String> isResource,
                           java.util.Properties recv,
                           Triple[] add)
        Will call the storageManager sendData method with the Lightweight Meta and the following created triples
        The triples add will be simply added
        The subject node will be the subject for every following triple

        For each key:value pair: subject results.key results.value
        Be aware that the Set isResource will set if the key/value will be handled as resources. If the key (value) is in the set it will be handled as a resource

        The getExtraMeta() method will be called, with the recv Property and the subject node Thus the following triples will be added:
        For each key:value pair: subject recv.key recv.value
        Parameters:
        subject -
        results -
        isResource -
        recv -

      • processData

        protected void processData(java.util.Properties extra,
                           java.util.Properties results)
        Assuming that the results are Integer objects, this will 1. if no data for extra exists, create the data from the results object 2. if the data exists, sum the corresponding for example: container has data object e1:(a:10, b:12) new results for e1 are (a:2, b:5) The new container data will be (a:12, b:17)
        Parameters:
        extra -
        results -
